content.heroSection:
Smithfield, NC Workers’ Comp Lawyers

When you are injured on the job, you are supposed to have recourse for the cost of your pain through workers’ comp. Ideally, workers’ comp should pay for your medical care, treatment for your mental health, and the time you miss at work. 

However, an unfortunate reality is that sometimes people are denied much-needed workers’ comp claims because of shady practices by employers and insurance companies.

The Smithfield workers’ comp lawyers of Vasquez Law Firm, PLLC, want to give you the resources you need to get access to the help you need. We have a clear track record of helping employees receive the damages they are owed, and we will apply all of our experience to getting the payment you need. 

Reach out to schedule a free initial consultation and learn how we can help you heal with peace of mind. 

Types Of Workplace Injuries

Workplace injuries are common. They can be big or small, but each one deserves the proportional compensation from your employer. Though you might think that workers’ comp applies only to factories with heavy machinery or construction sites where people often slip and fall, the truth is that workplace injuries happen all over America, and many of these employees need legal recourse to access what they are owed. 

Here are some examples of common injuries that can happen in your office or site:

  • Overexertion and heavy lifting: This is the most common type of injury on the job. If you are trying to lift heavy objects that weigh too much or with the wrong technique, you can become seriously injured. 
  • Repetitive motion injuries: Doing the same thing over and over again, even if that movement happens to be very small, can cause muscle deterioration and lead to strain that could turn into debilitating permanent injury. Even if you sit down during the day, you can still be performing wrist motions that lead to carpal tunnel, for example. 
  • Equipment-related injuries: Working with equipment can go dangerously wrong. From negligence to malfunction to improper maintenance and chemical corrosion, there are a whole host of dangers that come with working with machinery.
  • Construction site injuries: In addition to equipment related injuries, construction sites can be dangerous areas thanks to falls, explosions, and structural collapses. There is a reason people often think of construction when they think of workers’ comp!
  • Mental health impairment: You might not know this, but if your workplace injury has caused or exacerbated your poor mental health outcomes, you are owed compensation to address it. Being injured can lead to depression, anxiety, and PTSD, all of which need treatment alongside your physical injuries. 

How Our Smithfield Workers’ Comp Lawyers Can Help

Sometimes a person is owed workers’ comp, but companies will try to weasel out of it to protect their bottom line. Insurance companies can be even worse. Sometimes claims are denied, and other times workers are offered way less than what they are owed. This is a predatory tactic that prevents you from claiming more in compensation because you have already reached a settlement.

The Smithfield workers’ comp lawyers of Vasquez Law Firm want to protect you from these types of predatory practices. If you are owed compensation, we will work with you to go after the full amount you are owed, and we will take the legal work off your plate so that you can focus on healing. 

Vasquez Law Firm Has Your Back

If you are struggling to get compensation you are owed for a workplace injury, Vasquez Law Firm, PLLC, can help. Reach out to schedule a free initial consultation and learn how we will seek justice on your behalf. 

Frequently Asked Questions

How much money am I owed from workers’ comp?

The amount of damages you are owed is calculated based on factors such as your medical bills and the amount of lost hours you have accrued due to your injury. When you work with our lawyers, we will help you assess the amount you should pursue.

Do I have to pay income tax on my workers’ comp benefits?

No, worker’s comp is not taxed.

How much time do I have to submit my workers’ comp claim?

In North Carolina, you have two years to submit your workers’ comp claim after the date of your injury.

Practice Areas

  • Smithfield, NC Auto Accident Lawyers
  • Smithfield, NC Immigration Lawyers
  • Smithfield, NC Workers’ Comp Lawyers
